body.name: Reliable Velocity 270IR Steam Iron - Auto Control Compact Vapor Generator with Sensor Technology, Patented Technology for Continuous Steam, Zero Leaks, Perfect Temperature, 8 Programmable Setting
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 4 hrs 22 mins
features: SENSOR TOUCH TECHNOLOGY - Velocity 270IR will respond to your touch. Simply placing your hand on the sensor activates the stream of steam and releases a powerful and steady flow.

DIGITAL DIAL - With 8 settings to suit a range of fabrics, the Velocity 270IR sets the accurate temperatures and steam volume for your clothes. From silk to denim, you can expect perfect wrinkle removal.
ANODIZED ALUMINUM SOLEPLATE - Scratch-resistant, easy gliding and made to last. This soleplate goes through an anodization process, giving it an extra layer of protection. Iron weighs 4 lbs.
AUTO OFF BYPASS - 8 Minute auto-shutoff and the option to bypass it puts you behind the wheel, or rather, behind the iron! You can step away and come back to a hot iron that’s ready to keep going.

AUDIBLE WARNING - No more guessing when your iron has heated to your desired temperature – the Velocity 270IR will give you an audible warning when it’s ready. So, go ahead and step away for a few minutes without worry.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Velocity Auto Control 270IR Compact Vapor Generator Steam Iron Velocity Auto Control 270IR Compact Vapor Generator Steam Iron The Velocity Auto Control 270IR is full of features including the sensor steam handle and 8 pre-programmed settings that put you in control to give you the ultimate ironing experience. The Velocity 270IR’s patented built-in steam generator produces endless continuous steam with no leaks. While traditional irons are prone to leaking and spitting, the Velocity irons use a patented 2-heating element and micro-pump technology that pre-heats the water and turns it into steam before it reaches the soleplate. The Velocity 270IR iron will give you perfect constant steam at even the lowest temperatures, yet are 100% safe for all fabrics.

COMPACT VAPOR GENERATOR Is continuous steam at low temperatures possible? Yes! With our patented dual heating element technology, water is heated before it reaches the soleplate, eliminating leaking and spitting. REVOLUTIONARY TEMPERATURE CONTROL With 8 settings to suit a range of fabrics, the Velocity 270IR sets the accurate temperatures and steam volume for your clothes. From silk to denim, you can expect perfect wrinkle removal. SENSOR TECHNOLOGY Velocity 270IR will respond to your touch. Simply placing your hand on the sensor activates the stream of steam and releases a powerful and steady flow.

PATENTED TECHNOLOGY Our most advanced iron yet, the Velocity 270IR is full of features that put you in control and give you the best ironing experience. Its patented dual heating element creates steam in the built-in steam generator, so it’s already hot when it reaches the soleplate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love love love this iron ♥
reviews.reviewText: I love love love this iron.I sew 8-10 hours a day. I want my iron on all day. You can turn off the shut-off timer which is the main reason I bought this iron.I've had several other brands and so far this one is worth the higher price. I hope it lasts me for the rest of my life.It has a little switch that lets you turn on the handle's steam switch. While the steam switch is on, when you grab the handle it shoots out high pressure steam.I turn the steam switch on and off all the time. Some times I want the the full steam. Sometimes I want the steam off because I'm working on something that requires me holding my fingers close to the iron.It's very easy to use. And nice and heavy, irons fabric beautifully.Filling the water reservoir is a bit awkward as you have to hold the iron at an angle, so it doesn't spill. But with the little water cup provided, it's a lot easier.The little trap door is a little hard to open but that's good because it doesn't leak when you use the iron. I will most definitely put up with this little awkwardness.It has heat setting 1-8. Hold the round switch to the right, it turns on. (Stop at the heat setting you want)Hold it to the left, it counts all the way down to zero and turns off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great iron for sewing
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful iron, although if you have weakness in your hands you might want to go with something more lightweight. The steam and temperature control is excellent. Related to prior reviews: the temperature settings are numeric and a little bit cryptic, but they are all printed on the base of the iron and so there is no need to consult the manual. And as a sound-sensitive person I do agree that this is a louder iron than I am accustomed to. I turn it off when not in immediate use, but this tradeoff is well worth it for the amazing result I am getting with my pressing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this iron
reviews.reviewText: I love this iron. It replaces a spitting Rowenta I've had for years. I like the heavier weight of it and especially because I can disable the auto-off function. I love the wide variety of different heat settings depending on what fabric is involved and functions are easy to switch between. It's super easy to switch from steam to dry ironing and the water tank is quite large. There isn't anything I can fault this iron for now that I've found out how to turn down the massive amount of steam it puts out. Everything about this iron is spot on and extremely well thought out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Steam function just quit after 3 months
reviews.reviewText: I loved this iron at first, very hot and great steam. But 3 months after unboxing steam just quit. It is too expensive for this quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars good function, a few mildly annoying features
reviews.reviewText: Just for context, I'm a quilter and a long time Rowenta user. I got tired of leaky Rowentas, so thought I would give the Velocity 270IR a try. I've had it for about a week and have used it for several hours. I'm not sorry I bought it, but I'm not 100% certain I would buy the same model again.Pros: It heats up quickly and produces plenty of heat and steam at the highest setting. The weight is comparable to my old Rowenta, which is a plus for me, but could be a con for anyone who doesn't like a heavy iron. The controls are straightforward, though I find the temp setting control stiff enough that I usually have to put both hands on the iron to change it.Cons: The following aspects annoy me, but could just as easily be an advantage to someone else.* It's "chatty". It beeps when it reaches temp (fine), it mutters the entire time you're actively pressing with steam. (I think it's the steam generator and so WAI.) It ticks when it is on standby. Please, shut up.* You have to set the temp, the steam on/off, and disable the auto-shut off every time you turn it on. This is a consequence of the digital controls that I had not thought of, and makes me wish it was mechanical.* The fill cover is quite stiff and thus a little difficult to open. I have to pry it up with a pen or scissors.* The anodized sole plate does not glide over the fabric as readily as the stainless sole plate I've had in the past.So far, so good on the leak front, but it's too soon to tell. IME, no iron leaks when it's new.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Steam Control
reviews.reviewText: Great steam control. Does NOT spit water out. A little expensive

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Below was my 1st review and I am now updating. After my 1st review the company reached out to me and after asking questions, they asked me to send a video of the iron for their technicians. A few days later, they said they would send me a return label for me to send them the iron. 2 to 3 weeks after I sent them the iron, I received a new iron in the mail. How happy I am to have my dream iron back! It works SO much better than the well-known brand name iron I bought to use while I was waiting for my Reliable iron to come back. I am very happily surprised that the company read the review and addressed my concerns. Thank you Reliable!1st review: I loved this iron until it stopped working. The features of this iron were all that I wanted in an iron, and it worked beautifully from December 22, 2023 until September 3, 2023. For the price I expected it to last longer. I followed the instructions. I would buy this again if it had lasted longer because it really was a dream. But I can't justify the price if I have to buy one every 9 months. I sew every day and use an iron every day. I turned it off with my light switch which worked well for me because I really liked the feature where I could turn off the auto turn-off. I am disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m a quilter and Reliable irons are the best brand I’ve ever used. I like that I can override the automatic turn off. It’s nice and heavy for pressing.

Very good iron, best steam system I’ve seen so far. It’s on the heavy side, but you get used to it. Doesn’t glide as smoothly as TFal’s, but in the end, it works well. What I like most is the ability to iron at lower temperatures but still having plenty of steam, reducing chances of leaving shiny traces. Good purchase.
Great iron with hand sensor for steam. Great quality . I purchased this for quilting and it is the best purchase i have made. Super fast shipping.
Bonne achat le fer est assez pesant mais il fait très bien la job ..je le recommande fortement

This iron did not work at all. I can only assume it was an out of box failure. It steamed for the first 5 minutes and then I could hear strange noises coming from the unit. It vibrated constantly whether steaming or not and then no heat as well. It sounded as if it was having trouble connecting to power within the unit. I followed all the instructions but could not get it to heat or steam. I am sure that if you got one that worked it would be good but that wasn't the case for me.
I like that it only steams when you touch the hangle.
